reviews.review_msg: the GOAT prof at sfu, he's the best prof/teacher ive ever had. Mund tingz are good tingz. He'll answer every question you have and will stay after class to answer everything even if it takes long

Amazing prof!! You can do really good in this class as long as you keep up with the loncapa, review notes and do lots of textbook questions. Tips for exam: do ALL of the textbook questions and redo the loncapa. I found this class to be a lot more easier than chem121 as it is way less concept heavy.
Great at coming up with different ways to explain the subject.
great teacher, very helpful and midterms/exams are easy. He tells you not to use the textbooks.

AMAZING PROF!! Incredibly helpful, super approachable if you have him as a lab instructor too! His exams are tough, but fair and you can do well if you study the note and do example problems. His notes are crystal clear, don't even need the textbook! Overall amazing prof, if you can take CHEM 121 or 122 with him, do it! You won't regret it!

He is an amazing professor!!This course was very similar to grade 12 chemistry. I reviewed my notes from grade 12 and did awesome in this class. I would suggest rewriting notes taken in class because his exams are solely based on the examples from class! just be sure to go over the textbook examples as well!
Hands down, the best prof I've had so far. Extremely helpful, knowledgable and all the other words to describe an awesome prof! My chemistry background is not great but he made everything so easy!
Very helpful prof, really wants you to succeed. Always willing to help and give advice, questions are welcomed. Always smiling and cheerful.

Garry Mund was my CHEM 122 lab prof and I found him very helpful and knowledgeable with the topics. He was always eager to help which was great, because the TA's were not helpful at all and could not speak English (what's new though..really). I would recommend taking a course with him as the prof.

gary you need to understand what it feels like to be an undergrad...i agree with the others...he is so mean that its incredible ive never encountered a prof this misleading...his midterm for this class was fair but his final was brutal!!! do not take his class...he needs to make his exams more suited to first years NOT phd students...
VERY HARD FINAL EXAM!! His midterm was fair but his final is killer...extremely misleading..but very helpful

Granted I've never fully understood chem, but still isn't an easy class.  MT/final are very difficult.  He'll ask questions you've never encountered (or ones in much more detail then you've encountered).  Also he ends class 15 mins early when he could be going over practice q's or something.  I paid for 50 mins not 35! Do not recommend Mund.
Good notes. Great prof.
Great professor who can actually teach. Is very approachable and nice, and explains concepts with ease. Also lets the class out early most of the time.
.....he let us out early!! wahoooooo

Nice guy overall and definitely recommend taking the class with him.  His notes are very clear and you wont really have to refer to the text.  Chem isn't entirely fascinating, but Mund aids in stiring up interest in it.  Exams are fair :) Just study capa, book questions, and you'll be fine.
FUN, KNOW WHAT TO EXPECT ON EXAMS, LETS U OUT OF CLASS EARLY

His notes are extremely clear and organized, loncapa's not too bad, and exams are ok so far. He's really nice and helpful. But the best thing about that course is that it always ends ten to fifteen minutes earlier..:D
From the classes I managed to make myself go to I conclude he's a pretty good teacher altough don't expect any explosions or things like that hahaha.

Excellent Prof! He's SO thorough w/ his notes & he's really patient. He's also there when u need help. He understands that u have other classes too, so he tries to lighten up ur load when it comes to exam time. Altho I bombed my final for some reason (I thot I did well), I still think he's great!
great prof. clear and informative lecture notes that actraully help with lon-capa.  but becareful of the final!
pretty good prof. good notes, just long; leave every class with a hand cramp. its a good thing he finishes 10-15 mins early all the time. tests are pretty hard though
Can be a bit boring at times, but goes over the material in depth and makes you feel confident about the final.

he's a fairly good prof. his notes r very good, so easy to zone out in class so the notes come in very handy. he always always finishes the lectures early but mostly because he writes so fast. very challenging final
He has a bit of a boring voice so it's kinda easy to ignore him when he's teaching. His notes are very clear and pretty good. Very organized.
He's a really good prof, his teaching methods are great, midterms is very fair, hw is not so bad, not too much of a twist, not too much hw too!

great prof. always finishes lectures up in 30 minutes and give more notes than some profs who go more than 50 minutes AND he answers questions. his tests are difficult but fair, the only bad thing about the course is the 60% final...if u take the course, get MUND, he is wicked.
i love his notes! so clear and to the point
Great teacher, easy midterms and really hard final!
Really good teacher! Makes it very clear on how to do well on the exams!!
great notes, but no notes posting??? and with an average of 5 pages of notes EVERY lecture.... this guy is crazy....he's not bad, but seriously not my type.
I only got a bad mark because I wasn't studying enough! But he is so kind!
Love him soooo much!
I loved that this class was so clear! He is amazing!
w prof (chem 121)

Read this 5/5 rating on his page: "Such a funny class, he makes chemistry so entertaining, did not disappoint and was excited the entire course! Hope he gets tenure!" You think a student wrote that? im crying bro this guy really wrote this himself. He is anything but ^ that. I hope he gets fired.
Take this class if you like crying every night.

This guy has horrible communication, he has no passion for what he teaches, his voice is monotone, and I don't understand how he became a professor. Do better SFU. Also, all the 5's you see on this page? He wrote them to balance out all the low ratings, 100%. No student talks like that, lets be real. Good try Paul, but you know what you're doing.

Dr. Li was an okay professor. He can only do so much as a professor. His exams were fair as most of the questions came straight out of lecture slides/Lon Capa and mc questions came from the practice sheets he posted on canvas. If you work 2 hours outside 1 hour lecture, you will end up with a good grade! Chemistry is not an easy subject.

No communication with TA and blame gen z and do not reflect his poor lecture only done with unorganized google search. The midterm was awful and the slides are just copy of the textbook. Did not go through material and just expect us to do with it. Hope people do not take the course with him in the future since I suffered from this nightmare.

I have no idea where the 5/5 ratings are coming from but I certainly would not believe them as even my TA had an obvious distain for him. His lectures were not at all helpful and the midterm was awful. Had a friend take it with a different prof - their midterm average was in the 80's, ours was 34%. Avoid at all costs.

Abusive to TAs, miscommunicates. Uses google image searches in place of proper slides. Took random attendance only after students gave up on learning from him, which was so he could refuse students help.

He repeatedly calls his students lazy when his exam average is 34%, entirely ignoring the fact AN EXAM SHOULD TEST MATERIAL THAT WAS TAUGHT.
Love this class!

ABSOLUTELY THE OPPOSITE OF AMAZING. He wrote all these reviews by himself to boost his own rating. DO NOT TAKE chem 122 with him it is absolutely horrible. He made one of the easiest courses seem like hell despite it only being a 2 credit course. EVERY single one of the 5 star reviews are FALSE DO NOT LET HIM DECEIVE YOU!!!!
Paul Li makes sure Chemistry is not a mystery! He is funny, caring and very reasonable.
Only con is that the final mark takes too long to release, other than that he is amazing!

Not sure where all these 5/5 ratings came from all of a sudden, maybe Paul Li made all those accounts to try to boost his rating. Don't believe any of them. Save yourself the trouble and wait until a different professor is available. He is rude, hard to understand, and here for the paycheck.

Google searches were used to explain major concepts. Tests did not seem fair and expected you to do a lot of research and self-studying beyond the lecture notes. The slides were not comprehensive and lacked information. Very frustrating and would avoid taking this class with this prof.
Professor Li was an excellent prof who ensured every student understood the lectures in every class by reiterating points he thought would be unclear 10/10!
The class was straightforward and clear, with little or no guidance and help, and was very kind and inspirational
This course made me love science even more, thinking of careers thanks to his inspirational guidance
Such a funny class, he makes chemistry so entertaining, did not disappoint and was excited the entire course! Hope he gets tenure!
I think Paul Li tries hard, and it shows! Class was clear, not confusing and exams were fair and straightforward if you came to class
Great prof, with a lot of passion for the subject, I enjoyed it greatly!
Final was way more fair
Avoid at all costs
Love him, love the course
Professor Li being bad at teaching is not true!
Very lovely, and makes you enjoy his class a lot
I think Prof Li has a bad rep, but he really is very nice
So kind and ready to help, I think he is one of the better chem profs
He may be tough at marking, but he curves really well
I think he is tough but fair, put in the work and you will get the mark
Eggcellent Proof. Love PaulLi, would have to take again for funsies
Amazing Prof, Would give him 6 stars if possible

This is not a case of me/my friends not studying enough and writing a bad review.

34% midterm average and he didn't care to acknowledge it in class

He put some titration questions from the lab on the midterm although the lab is not required to take.

Asked about 4 regions, and yet no homework was given on it.

Midterm has no correlation to MT
Slides are useless, and questions on test are not from lecture material.
he's great.
Lectures are a waste of time. Terribly designed test. Avoid him if you can.
lectures are terrible and disorganized, teach yourself with loncapa and youtube, don't take this guy if you have a choice because you will realize that our ratings were correct.

If you take classes with this prof, get ready to teach yourself the entire course. His lectures are a disorganized waste of time, and he loves searching up topics that he doesn't know how to explain on google images during lecture time. He tries to be funny, but he's not. His voice is also really annoying.

Paul Li is literally the worst prof I have ever come across. Avoid if you can. If you can't, well then be prepared to teach yourself the whole course, and be destroyed on every exam. My advice? Ride the curve.
worst prof at sfu. Avoid at all costs. Disorganized lectures and horrible exams

He was a very sweet guy and had a lot of office hours. But his practice questions and what he told us to study was not accurate, the midterm and final was really difficult. The grading scheme also wasn't the best because we only had a midterm and a final.

He was a sweet guy but sucked at teaching thermochem, I crashed out a few hours before the final because his thermochem question made no sense and at some point he didn't know what he was talking about in his office hour before the exam. Sweet guy tho.

Dr. Walsby is a super caring and friendly person and was a lovely prof. During office hours, he made sure to answer everyone's questions before he left and was very helpful answering questions. only downside was that your grade relies heavily on the midterm and final. Also I loved his accent; it made lectures so much better.

Dr. Walsby is an amazing prof, clearly cares a lot for his students. This course is a little dry and very math heavy, but he makes it tolerable. Grade is almost solely based off the final. Averages were quite low, but ended up being scaled about 2 letter grades. Lectures end in early November which was helpful for other courses.

Genuinely a super nice guy and cares about his students. The only problem was that he graded everyone based on the midterm, final and homework so everything wasn't very balanced. Other than that, I would highly recommend this prof

The professor is nice and he does a lot of practice questions in class. But the midterm and final were really hard and were really different from the practice questions he did and the practice exams he provided.

Dr. Walsby is a chill prof. He was very helpful for seeking some advice and help after the midterm, and of course, the final was worth a bit too much for my liking...but in the end his lessons were clear, and he does a lot of examples during lectures. An overall helpful prof who is ready to help his students.

i was genuinely enchanted by walsby every lecture, it was not a waste of time to go. attending tutorials as well was helpful as he provides a worksheet to the tas for you to run through. the course was more than fair and he is a natural teacher with a great sense of humour and quick to answer emails.
I would honestly recommend dr. walsby because he really goes into detail on what to study and whats on exams. 60-70% final is insane though but to be honest not that bad. all around good prof!
Amazing prof, so sweet with clear criteria.
70% final is nasty work but he gives a lot of practice questions for both the final and midterm and he's generous with loncapa tries. Nice guy

He's an amazing prof and I'd recommend taking any course with him. His lectures are well structured and his teaching is clear. He encourages students to send him emails and ask questions. The course is tough but he provides tons of practice examples and tips to prepare for exams. It's very exam heavy. Definitely attend tutorials and office hours.

Loved his lectures. He made the course content easy to understand, and each calculation was laid out step by step. He was super clear about what was going to be on the exam and gave us tons of practice questions, too (with written solutions). He's a super nice guy, would recommend taking this course with him.

He was literally the best prof I've ever had at sfu. Lectures didn't put me to sleep, his voice is always bright and he's interested in what he teaches, making him approachable. Go to tutorials it really helps.

By far the best scientific lecturer I have had at SFU. Chemistry is not an easy subject, but he does a great job of explaining scientific concepts in lectures to generate understanding. Come to all lectures, take good notes (dont just copy everything he writes) and do all practice problems for tests and you will pass easily.
we need more teachers like him. He gets it.
Somewhat easy to understand. Very accommodating and nice. Answers quite simply, similarly to Professor Warren.
If you need to take a Chem class, do yourself a favour and take it with him. I cannot say enough good things about him and his teaching style.

Great prof. Easy to listen to, good lectures, great person. He really encourages questions which is nice, it shows that he truly is passionate about his career and teaching us students. Totally recommend taking one of his courses, you won't regret it!
Great guy and an amazing lecturer. Almost all of our grade was our final so you definitely have to make it count but it was really reasonable. Love his accent as well.

Definitely a great prof! He was always happy to answer questions and really wanted us to succeed. Tutorials and LON-CAPA helped with midterm/final, and the exams were pretty hard, so do lots of practice questions. Lectures were boring sometimes but that's not rly his fault

Amazing prof who really wants everyone to do well. Going to lectures is a must because topics go by really fast and notes aren't available online. The grading is difficult because 60-70% of your mark is based on the final. MAKE SURE you study the lon-capa's for the exams!

Great teacher but challenging course. Lectures were not recorded and filled notes weren't posted so attendance is necessary. Very easy to fall behind because you are only marked by Lon Capa assignments (every few weeks) and exams. Tutorials are optional as well.

His lectures were clear and straight forward and the exams were on exactly what we learned. Lectures could be a bit boring at times, but that's the materials fault not Dr. Walsbys. Great prof, would love to have him again.
Walsby really cares about his students and it shows in the times he puts into having extra office hours and help sessions.
He is one of the best profs. He is an amazing lecturer and his exams were fair with fair grading schemes. He is hilarious. and the homework was very helpful.
Best professor

Professor Walsby is absolutely amazing. His lectures are easy to follow, he makes sure his students actually understand, super accommodating, super approachable and overall just a really nice caring guy. Really goes out of his way for his students, to the point of creating personalised question banks. First time I've enjoyed chem in awhile tbh

The best lecturer Ive ever had, its seriously insane. Hes kind and understanding I cannot stress to you how amazing of a prof he is, his notes are incredible and I actually enjoyed coming to chem class. He goes above and beyond any other prof, during midterms he made 8 extra office hours. He 100% deserves all the praise he gets this mans a god.

Lectures are crucial to this course. He is engaging and a good lecturer. The lecture slides are very useful, and I would recommend looking over them constantly throughout the course. He is quite accommodating, fair, and nice. I found the exam and the coursework very difficult and had to put in a ton of effort for a mediocre grade.
Amazing professor who can deliver information with concision the likes of which has never been seen before on this Earth.

Amazing prof! Lectures are concise but to the point, does good job explaining how to solve problems and concepts. Provides lots of example questions in lecture and on canvas and practice test which are helpful in preparing for the exam. Even tutorial material provided is helpful and relevant for studying. Just keep practicing to do good.
Great prof! Truly unlike others

He's got a pretty high rating on here and he 300% deserves it. He's a GREAT prof in every way tbh. Explains things well, approachable, gives enough practice material and cracks a few jokes here and there lol. If you have the chance to take his class, DO IT.
best prof out there
He is a great prof! Always enthusiastic and approachable for help. He also tries to condense the information as much as possible so that you can understand some complex problems.

He is a really great professor.  Doesn't go through the material fast no matter how behind we are in schedule.  His midterm is easy. Make sure you study hard, and score high on that because his final was hard. For the midterm, go through the examples he did in class and in tutorial.
Amazing professor!

If you need to take CHEM 122 take it with Walsby. He's the kind of guy who's always there to help you out and wants to make sure you do well. He respects all questions, answers emails, and is generally a great guy. I enjoyed my chem class because of him.

One of the best chemistry profs at SFU. Always encourages students to use his office hours(mentions it like every class). Provides every equation you'll need so there is no need for memorizing them. Very clear explanations. Provides many examples of problems you'll see on tests. Exams are pretty tough. Make sure you keep up with the material!

Charles is an absolute sweetheart. He answers any of your questions during office hours and makes sure you understand it. He cares about his students' success and focus on his tutorials and in class examples if you want to excel. Tests are tough but doable. He's one of the best chem prof at SFU ever.
Hard exams. Very helpful and nice fellow. Gives every equation there is which is extremely helpful.
Super great guy! Keep up with the readings, loncapa helps a bit too.
Charles Walsby is an amazing professor. His lecture notes are very clear and he goes through many useful examples in class. I highly recommend taking Chem122 with him.

Super nice and helpful during office hours, and really clears up any difficulties you may have had. Doesn't make you memorize any equations which is nice and he makes the class interesting. Would recommend him!
Such a great professor. His lectures are clear and fair, he is extremely available for help if anyone need it, and he's hot.  One of my favourite profs ever.

Everything top notch. Clear concise lecture notes. Everything's great except the grading scale. Make sure you get a good mark on LONCAPA and midterm or there's a good chance to fail the course because of final. He did however provided practice questions beforehand that were similar to the final. :D

One of the best profs I've had at SFU so far. Super informative and helpful, except in office hours. He is condescending and MEAN. I went twice and regretted it both times, he left me feeling stupid and angry. Don't go to his office hours unless you want to lose confidence (especially right before the final like I did).
Definitely one of the nicest profs I had this semester. He has a pleasant personality and is extremely helpful whenever you need clarification. I would definitely recommend his class!
He is a great professor. I loved going to his classes. Just do most of the examples at the end of each chapter and you will do fine on his exams.

Great Prof. Course wasn't that hard anyways but his lectures were very clear nonetheless. The final exam was harder than expected. Need to study. Do loncapa questions, the questions aren't hard at all so it's a 15% to get.

Great prof at explaining concepts and notes. Pretty hard exam in terms of how long it is (which was very long), some tricky questions but overall straight-forward, very kind and willing to help which was great.
One of the greatest profs to ever exist. Very funny and very informative lectures

Walsby is the best professor I have had at SFU thus far. First year students - yes he's better than Justin Gray. He's extremely friendly, makes it really easy to understand, and if you understood the material his exams weren't hard. I hope this guy teaches second year chem because 122 was an easy A!!

Best prof ever! keeps lectures entertaining, and notes crystal clear. He goes through everything in detail with examples, and lets you know which questions will be on the exams. The midterm was alright...but not so much for the final! Plus he makes sure every single student comes to his office hours to see where they went wrong on the midterm:)

He's an awesome prof! His lectures are very detailed and he goes through how to do every type of problem step by step. However, all that is useless because the questions on the final were NOTHING like in the lecture, notes, or textbook. I am usually an "A" student in chem and thought I knew everything, but his final whooped my ass. Be warned.

Honestly, he is a real nice guy, and very helpful too, probably one of the nicest profs I've met! AND he is VERY smart! But if you're not that good in chem, and are looking for an A, do NOT take his class because his exams are super hard and super long!

Honestly, I'm the type of student that studies for midterms and finals the day before the exam. Charles Walsby made that very possible for me with his extremely concise but clear lecture notes. His examples in class are very helpful, but I find that I don't really pay much attention in class - probably because the course material is review, though.
Pretty good prof. Literally tries to make sure every single student in the class knows the material. Tricky exams n very strapped for time...even for the final. All-in-all a cool guy and very helpful
My favourite prof, extremely helpful and super nice. I loved coming to this class just because of him

He was an amazing teacher.  He was super clear and answered questions immediately.  He also did experiments in class sometimes which was cool and I would definetely recommend this guy to everyone, whether your a chem student or not or even if your taking it as you B-sci course.

One of the best profs ever in terms of notes.  They were clear, helpful and makes the course understand-able in a glance.  Exams were fair except for a tougher final.  An interesting and sometimes funny prof.  Would recommend taking a course with him.
Excellent prof! Made lectures enjoyable, fair exams and good at teaching not just lecturing topics.  Overall, great prof.
Extremely clear, punctual, and good notes.  Really good lecturer.
amazing prof....take chem 122 with him if you have the chance
if you can survive chatting with him on the skytrain, you can survive his class
Amazingly nice guy, friendly and willing to help. worth going to lecture.

Fun, interesting, clear professor that made class fun to go to. He has really good notes but watch out for the exams! They're very long and very tricky. I ran out of time for both the midterm and the final.

We haven't had our midterm yet so I can't judge him on hardness, but he is the clearest, most animated prof I have had in Chemisty. I actually don't mind going to lecture, which is saying a lot. He also does cool experiments and really connects with his students. Thumbs up!
He is not a professor but a teacher's assistant.  What a fake.
Terrible instructor and individual.
Best
He is not a prof though. He is a TA! Almost zero-knowledge about the topic and never properly prepared for the lectures.
Really great! Even gives additional tutorials and really helpful

Great professor; easily one of my favourites. His notes are very helpful and thorough. His tests are somewhat difficult, but if go to class, read over his notes, do the LONCAPA, and do textbook questions for review you should be fine.

im still surprised i pulled off an A-. she spent too much time reviewing the content for balancing equations, stoichiometry and rushed all the new, hard subjects. if she went into more detail on the new material, the class would have been better.
Nice person but not clear because of his accent. Slow class in general.

CHEM122 was practically a review of high school chemistry 12 with a few harder elements added. Eikerling's lectures got boring around the 2nd one and it's very easy to fall asleep in his class but the LONCAPA and the tests are pretty fair. A lot of entropy, enthalpy and Kp on the final.
Eikerling is a nice guy, but he literally makes no sense. The midterm is brutal

Excellent prof if you're willing to put in the work that it takes to be successful -- and would you expect any different for a class in thermodynamics and kinetics? It's tough material but Prof. Eikerling is savvy and willing to share it if you take the time to ask and work hard. Looking forward to upper level thermo and electrochem with him.
What motivation to switch majors? Take a class with him and you will be running!

Be prepared physically and mentally to sit in lecture. It gets real boring real quick. Midterm was alright, TA's were super helpful. He really loves thermodynamics, and that topic alone pretty much sums up the entire final. Final was straight up brutal. Don't recommend taking it with him.

Very kind professor,  somewhat difficult but thats the nature of the course and not due to the professor. Contrary to what people are saying  his accent is not bad at all. Reccomendations: Read the whole thermodynaics chapter in the textbook and go to office hours.  Go through and do the problems he posts in lecture it will appear on exams
final is really hard!! it all base on thermodynamic!!!!! midterm is fair.  But, ancient is too strong. sometime idk what he is saying:(

Wow. Insane class. The accent is not at all a problem. It's German but not hard to understand at all. Most people here just get flustered when there's a foreign accent around. The tests on the other hand... killer. The final was so insanely hard, I was sure I failed. The class average had to have been a fail.

Dr. Eikerling is a very nice guy, and could be a great teacher for upper level courses. However, this class with him was a nightmare. His lectures were essentially nap or gaming time, and he only cared about the students who sat up front. Midterm was fine, final was brutal. I give credit for my A to the TA's, textbook, and the curve... not him.

Yeah his accent is hard to understand but I can promise that if you do questions from the textbook and read his notes before attending the lecture, you can get a really good grade. His exams are super fair and he loves thermodynamics! at least 60% of the final was thermodynamics

To the person above, you are one legit student. I couldn't keep up with anything he was saying. Only the TA's helped. But that wasn't enough to save me from the grotesque mark I received at the end. The prof is a nice guy but those ppt slides are confusing as heck. This class is more like nap time than anything. Sorry Prof Eikerling.

Really nice proff, he is a bit awkward and has an accent but is extremely helpful if you ask for help. He is kind of more interested in thermodynamics than kentics. Some people complain about his accent but it is not that bad if you actually try and pay attention. His midterm was super easy and final was fair. Gives really good notes.

His accent makes the lectures hard to follow. During final exam, few mistakes that he had to make announcements for, but no one understood what he was trying to correct so it was very confusing... nice guy though, just can't teach well. I would suggest taking this class with another prof if possible, otherwise be prepared to learn on your own
Extremly difficult to keep up with his teaching, which is very confusing. He's a really nice guy, but his final killed everyone.

One of the best chemistry profs! He is extremely helpful and explains everything very well so it is easy to understand the material. Midterms and final were very fair and covered lon capa questions as well as his lecture notes.

I cannot find a single flaw with this professor. I regret so, so much that I did not try harder for the final--he was infinitely patient, helpful, and everything that he explained was crystal clear. If he is teaching another course in the future I would definitely take his classes again.
Only thing bad about him is that he doesn't stop ppl talking in class, therefore the lecture hall is always very noisy. If you wanna do well you have to sit very close to him.
This is what I call a dedicated prof. He'll spend hours of his own time just to go over things like midterms for you, even though he's not obliged to. A rarity these days!
he's a very nice guy...

I did not find his lectures to be of any use, although went to all of them for clickers. I managed to get an A+ in his class solely studying from the textbook, doing multiple problems in the textbook, and reviewing loncapa/tutorial questions.
Will talk for 30 mins for a slide that only has 4 words on it. Doesn't really go over example problems in lecture in detail but that's what tutorial if for. Other than that, OK prof

Useless lectures, only attended for iClicker. Very boring, and spends hours explaining useless simple stuff, then tests on much more difficult problems and concepts. Also very disorganized in his slides as well as in posting marks/exam results. All exams are done on scantron with both multiple choice and exact answer questions.

Difficult to pay attention in class due to his long-winded lecture style, but very helpful during office hours. Gives out some easy marks for iClicker & LonCapa. Preparing for exams was very challenging. Very few problem sets done in class and, as mentioned previously, the LonCapa/tutorial problems are easier than exam problems. Would not recommend

Perhaps due to the simplicity of the materials, Prof. Williams paces in speed that is too slow. Another problem is his wordy lecturing style. Midterms and assignments are extremely easy, whereas the final maybe a little bit more frustrating for some students because of a lack of time. Generally, a recommended professor.

he spends too much time on the easy stuff. The Lon Capa and practice problems are way too easy compared to what was on the final. You cannot prepare for the final in anyway but study the material and pray. Lecture slides were very disorganized, he kept making mistakes and the solutions to the problem sets were full of mistakes. Avoid him.
lectures were dry but exams were so free. just read the textbook and self study. exams were copy and paste from practice exams and textbook questions

Andrew Bennet was alright. Lectures were kinda boring but they were informative and easy enough to follow, and the textbook was pretty useful as a reference for any material you didn't get, or more practice. The lon-capa questions were good practice too. Nothing spectacular but nothing awful either
His lectures were very boring and I found that his explanations were hard to understand. He did give practice questions that were on the actual midterm and final.

AJB had boring lectures and at times can be confusing despite the easy concepts. However he was nice to talk to, just not about lecture material. I would highly recommend reading the textbook and doing textbook problems. Tests were fair with no surprises.

Course was easy but by no means was he extraordinary. His slides for the first few units were really hard to follow since there was barely information on them (they were a summary of the textbook). I understood the textbook better than a single word that came out of his mouth. I hope he has a very QUIET retirement.

Took his class during his last year as a professor before retirement. His lectures slides were hard to follow, listening to him during class was painfully difficult, and would make a ton of mistakes doing example problems. Worst professor I've ever had, but the course is easy so I guess it balances out.

His lectures are bland and he reads off of slides and doesn't explain the concepts very well. The only way to get a good grade is to read the textbook and do LOT'S of questions. His only redeeming quality is that his exams are fair, and not too challenging. And OF COURSE, be prepared to hear some EXCEEDINGLY repetitive language (you'll see).

He is a pretty good prof. His exams were pretty straightforward, based on the practice exams and lectures. Despite the lectures a bit dry, it was helpful for the exams. I'm glad to be in his class. It's interesting that he had been teaching at SFU for over 30 years and this class is his last class. I wish him all the best in life !

The exams were pretty straight forward, doing the textbook questions and practice exams were helpful to prepare. notes were also good. At times lectures were boring but i do recommend attending them. Even though Bennet wont be teaching anymore i had to leave this review for the goat. Thx prof. Bennet.

By far, Dr. Bennet was my favourite professor so far. He was an amazing instructor who was very passionate about Chemistry and teaching it. He also had a great sense of humour. If you had a question, he would not ridicule you but explain the concepts more for you, and he was very patient. Homework was fine, and the exams were very fair. GOAT PROF!!

He is a bland as oatmeal, he's also British (derogatory) who shamed the class on the midterm, and went through what percent failed each question, before even giving the grades back 1.5 weeks later (it was all multiple choice literally shouldn't take so long). He also has the most boring lectures ever and is very rude when you ask any questions.

Go to office hours. Bennet, Merbouh, and other profs have bad rating because people were upset they got a bad grade when they were either online during covid and/or didn't go to office hours. HE IS SO HELPFUL AND WHOLESOME. Stop shading on a great prof. Take the course with him, pass, and be done.

Andrew had fairly easy exams, but by no means was he an astounding teacher. All material on his slides was taken verbatim from the textbook, and yet it still made more sense when I would read it in the textbook. I absorbed nothing from his lectures and was forced to teach everything to myself via the textbook and youtube videos.

takes CHEM 122, sees Bennet's ratings

*scared* 

goes to lessons, review sessions, takes exams

*gets A+* 

COME ON MAN, DIS TOO EASYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY

hands down, best CHEM 122 Prof ya gonna get
best prof, no cap
love dis dude
Good prof, its just sometimes that his slides can be a little difficult to read.
Average was B in Fall 2022. Easy course.

Took this course in Fall 2022. HW-5%, iClicker-5%, MT-35%, Final-55%. 

Don't know how he is in previous years. But he is one of the best Prof in teaching CHEM 122 now.

If you are taking CHEM 122 with Prof Bennet after Fall 2022, don't be scared of the 1's rating below. Do your job as a student, and you will attain great success in this course.

Professors are here to guide us to the correct path not handing us answers. 

Learning and education are our own responsibilities. People who only blame others and doesn't reflect on how to improve themselves would never succeed. Always stays a failure!

Go to his review sessions, he will go through the practice exams questions and provides detailed answers. His exams are pretty much copy and paste from the practice and iClicker questions (which he posts on canvas). 

If you actually use the resources he provided, this course would be a grade booster.

Though it says there is participation, you can take advantage of the iClicker online version, where you don't need to be present to answer the questions. Participation depends on you answering questions rather than getting it correct.

Professor Bennet's lectures' slide might be a bit messy, but overall it highlights the main point of every concepts. It should be used as a guide rather than the main studying tool, since textbook is the primary resource he used and contains most information.

Get ready to read the textbook and learn on youtube because his lecture slides are not helpful. I pretty much managed to succeed in his class because of his practice exams and it was very nice of him to reuse a lot of those similar questions on the exam. I'm giving him a high rating because although he wasn't great at teaching, his exams were fair.

To be fair, Andrew is not a bad prof at all, his lectures are just dry. If I could go back and do one thing, I would have reviewed his practice midterm and final exams - as the actual exam questions are taken from these practices. Overall, course was not the most thrilling and it was easy to get lost but focus on the lectures and do the practice!!!

Prof Bennet's most redeeming quality are his fair tests and final. He gives good practices material leading up to exams and even held review sessions. However, his lectures are very dry and can be hard to follow. The slides are just watered down textbook bullet points.
He's very fair and teaches amazing!
Best prof!
He is amazing and very helpful! Idk why people are rating him low...with fair amounts of effort you can enjoy this class a lot!
He is super nice and very very fair. His exams are perfect!! You will definitely score good if you focus on everything that's done in the class. His class was the best!! Hands down the best prof!
Every lecture he blurts KAWWNSTUNT and it makes me lose my sanity, his voice is so annoying! Andrew Bennet needs to learn how to speak.
DO NOT TAKE THIS DUDE JUST DONT DO IT

Prof. Bennet's quizzes and midterm was okay, but his final exam was hell!! The guy had way too many questions on the final and expected us to finish it. The other issue with him was that he doesn't know how to teach, not only is his voice super boring, but he has no interest. The only reason I survived was because of the textbook and Clayton
not a good teacher

No idea what Professor Bennet was doing all semester, having 0 office hours the full term. He definitely did not care at all for the students, and wanted to finish his lecture as quick as possible to get out of there.

Professor Bennet was alright at best. Quizzes were hard and lectures were quite dry, but the exams were fair overall. His lecturing style could definitely be improved upon as they weren't the most engaging like mentioned before. However all semester he didn't have any office hours so it felt like he wasn't really there to help students.

Doctor Andrew Bennett should not be employed a university. He has been the worst teacher I have ever experienced in my life. He doesnt teach, his lectures are useless and his final was impossible. Not enough time and it wasnt even fair questions. Dont put yourself through the pain of chem 122 with him. You will regret every second.

if you think you can teach yourself a semester's worth of chemistry without any help then maybe you can make it out of this class alive. his lectures were so useless that I stopped watching 1 week in. no office hours and certainly no answered emails. I would avoid this prof at all cost.
Great lecturer, fair quizzes, midterm and final. My marks really reflects that. Highly recommend if you want to get a mark as high as mine!!!
Solid prof. The quizzes he made were quite hard, but the exams were doable. Lectures weren't engaging but lecture slides were clear.
I would not take his class again. Ever.

Midterm was ok. Final was pretty hard but lots of lon capa questions. Lectures are boring but he went through lots of examples. The man was nice enough to out two questions he step by step in a review lecture on the final exam. Seems like a nice enough guy, but not a great lecturer.

The midterm was quite good. Most of the midterm questions were from the Loncapa homework. However, the final exam was a totally different story. There were lots of difficult questions and most of the students in the class were not able to finish them on time. The lectures were super bad. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!

If you are looking to take Chem 122 avoid Bennet at all costs. Lectures consisted of him reading off the slides. They were dry and difficult to get through, even on 2x speed. He doesn't hold office hours. You're better off just reading the textbook. The mt was fair but the final, worth 45%, was much harder.

His midterm was more fair than his final but the final was worth so much more that it didn't matter. The quizzes that we had to do were aids, there was little to no way to prep for them. You have to learn the units by yourself mainly as his lectures were just pointless and bland with no enthusiasm at all. DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM.

TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE. TERRIBLE. UNORGANIZED, LACKS ALL PASSION FOR THIS COURSE. SLOW. WATCHED LECTURES ON 2X SPEED EVERY SINGLE TIME. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOURSELF. THIS IS WHAT TRUE PAIN IS. MIDTERM WAS FAIR BUT THAT FINAL.... AVOID Dr Bennet at all costs. He made what shouldve been an easy course EXCRUCIATINGLY HARD.

Dr Bennett does seem a little all over the place teaching CHEM 122 but Im going to give him benefit of the doubt because Ive heard that he doesnt like teaching inorganic chem as much as orgo. I found his midterm to be fair but his quizzes throw you off sometimes, so on the difficulty scale I would give him around a 3.5.

Seems like a good guy but he is the most unorganized prof I've ever had. Lectures were horrible at first, but he took feedback and improved his system so it was easier to follow along. Pretty boring lectures overall (watched on 1.4x speed and it wasnt bad). Midterm was basically just the homework so not sure why the average was so low.

He does not seem like he is ready to teach, explains course material very poorly and overall absolutely disorganized. He had the audacity to even put the stuff that he claimed those would not be on the quiz. ***Definitely avoid him at all cost.

Lecture are boring but he has a very good understanding of the material and seems to really care for the students. I like his exam style and he is very available and willing to help. Frequent i clicker questions weighed both on correct answer and participation. Overall a pretty good experience. Took him again for another class.

Seems like a nice guy, but pretty terrible at explaining concepts and engaging the class in the material. The exams seemed very foreign to the material covered in class, since it was calculation-heavy and barely any example calculations we demonstrated in lecture.

One of the worst profs i have encountered. It is very hard to learn in this class, mostly just blindly clicking random answers for iclicker participation & randomly guessing on the exams. He puts questions from loncapa on the written response sections.

This guy only read concepts off his powerpoints and did no practice questions to show how to do problems. I had to watch youtube videos to teach myself the material. Only easy part of the class was when he copy pasted some of the questions from the review questions worksheet and put them on the final exam. Don't take him.

Lectures are informative if you have a genuine interest in chemistry, but will not help you score in exams. Exam questions mainly consist of calculations, similar to LONCAPA. Overall difficulty is about the same as CHEM121.

Avoid 122 with Bennet like the plague. Horrible lecturing skills - anything that we learned was from the textbook. The most meaningful lecture I got out of this class was the last review day where he FINALLY showed us how to actually do problems (which by the way are the only things you even do on exams in this course!!). Absolute waste of time.

Dr. Bennets enthusiasm of chemistry and his amazing lecturing skills cannot be replicated by just an average professor (Other professors just dont SWEAT knowledge).Lectures are great and actually very productive if youre behind on a T.V. show and need to catch up. Great class to be in as long as youre not enrolled or have to write the exam.

Bennet is not the best lecturer, but he will take the time to explain something to you if you go to office hours, His exams were actually very straight forward and if you go to lecture and can do the loncapa then you will be fine, i had to teach myself quite a bit but the level he expects for the exam isnt much harder than chem 12.

He will not reply your emails. He goes through examples in his PowerPoint, literally just reading through it very fast and that's not helping at all. His test is amazingly hard, he said there is one MC question that only 3 people got right. He just make us go to his lecture by making the iCliker question worth 10%. I'd rather take with another prof

Not a good prof at all. Lectures are not helpful at all when it comes to the midterm. The examples are all on the power point and he talks through it rather than showing it. If you take chem 122 with him, don't expect to be taught by anyone except yourself.

Don't ever take any class with this professor. He will not explain the test material. He forces us to attend his class by making up the iCliker participation mark. I'd rather read the textbook than go to lecture.

Whoever said 122 was easier than 121 was lying. Bennet isn't someone you should take chem with, esp. if you're not that great at chem or simply hate it. His notes are not helpful when it comes to exams. You're better off reading the textbook than attending his classes. Very monotone professor too. A lot of ppl do their own stuff in class I noticed.

This professor is the hardest one in SFU. Just don't take the Chemistry courses with him wait for another term. The class average was about C-/D and his test was the hardest. DON'T TAKE THE CLASS W/ HIM IF YOU WANT TO PASS!

His lectures aren't very helpful. Make sure you read the textbook! Tests are unfairly hard. The content of the course requires a lot of comprehension of mechanisms and processes. He defines and states but does not explain them.
The class average is very low. If you are not a chemistry person, don't take the class with him. Hard to pass.
No Comments
easy midterm, but kill you on final, WATC
A bit monotonic, but generally ok.

I already have a bad impression of Dr. Forde. I was asking for help on the pre-lab, and made sure to thoroughly explain my problem. Unfortunately, he basically repeated what I'd already told him I knew and I felt pressured and rushed to ask my questions as there were other people waiting for help. Would drop 126 if I wasn't taking Chem 122.
Very engaging, easy to understand lectures.  Used I-clickers so most students attended class.  The tests were fair.
not bad but not great either
overall great prof.  Exams were fair, just study the textbook.
talks to himself

If you had Hanlan for Chem 121, you MIGHT find it easier taking him for chem 122. He's not as bad as that horrible woman, BUT HE'S GETTING THERE...His multiple choice section on the midterm's worth 3 marks each so if you get one wrong, tough luck...Yes I know, he's a jerk but at least the course is alot easier to handle with than 121.

Sophie is a passionate prof! Very nice to her students. But in her class you are mostly on your own. Study her notes. She likes her own lec notes. Go to her office hours, and TAs are helpful too. Put in your effort then you shouldnt end up so bad.
No Comments
^^; not very good at teaching lectures..she's better in the labs..i got her for chem 122..she's like a grandmother figure, really nice and friendly, her exams were ok though.

she explains things very slow. it's almost as if she thinks you are mentally handicapped. but it works if you listen to her. tests are quite fair as long as you pay attention and don't laugh the whole class at her foreign expressions.
I thought this course was easy!  Great attitude, nice person, great notes, and HUGELY ENTHUSIASTIC, I don't know what she puts in her coffee, but I want some of that!

She's very helpful, truly loves chemistry, and is truly interested in the success of her students. Additionally, the fact that her assignements are difficult yet she is well liked really says something!
She is BRUTAL!
best prof ever!! half of the class time is always spent on experiments!!  great explosions that attracted security and the fire department!!  mind-term/final  is not to bad for those who are smart!!
course was so easy he had to make stupid nit-picky questions for the exam
Notes were okay . . . nice experiments & Man U rocks!
Great prof, Great teaching
Entertaining lectures but difficult exams.
He's entertaining - I liked the experiments
No Comments
Hypnotic monotone.  Will put you to sleep after 5 pots of coffee
No Comments
this guy is just awful
Even though there are some interesting demonstrations during lecture, the lectures are generally boring and uninformative. One really must teach themselves the course, or risk failing.
Worse prof ever, very unclear, hard exams, and boring

I don't think I've ever fallen asleep so many times in a course before.  He needs to liven up his lectures before anyone will pay attention, since most of the class is filled with chatting students anyway.
Hill's lectures are confusing and useless. The tests and CAPAs don't correspond.
lectures kinda boring, reading textbook might be easier
No Comments
He's funny at first....but you will get BORE afterwards~ with all his so called   CONCRETE   lectures....
midterms more challenging than average.  lectures generally useless - speaks too quickly for ppl to follow.... power point notes are useless...never gets lecture notes or marks up in time...
Boring lectures, useless notes, poor attitude.
puts everyone to sleep 5 minutes in to his lectures, can survive quite well in the course w/o attending his lectures.  stares down at students....
No Comments
Poor at giving explainations and very boring speaker. However, good experiments

I self teach myself for almost all my courses so the lectures were ok. The end of chapter questions from the textbook definitely helped (just pick the most important ones) as well as YouTube. I think the exams were all multiple choice questions (good for me since I know wouldn't show my work well).

Her lectures are kinda boring, as she just reads off the slides. The slides are also just based on the textbook, a lot of stuff is taken straight from the textbook. This means u might have to learn by reading the textbook. But her tests (midterm and final) are really easy. My midterm was 20 ish mc and final was 35mc.

I really enjoy her lectures and the course content is relatively easy! I liked the midterm and she does a lot of review questions beforehand. She talks to every student during labs personally and asks us about ourselves.

if Corina is ur only option ur better off taking it a diff sem. Corina likes to read directly off her slides (word for word) so lecture is not very engaging. She also finished our last unit 3 days before our final, to which 11/50 questions were dedicated to this unit.

Avoid this class at all costs, lots of homework, her teaching method is to read lecture slides that don't even correlate to the homework so you're left to learn it yourself, the way the class is run is so confusing. Prof often asks class questions but is so rude and belittling when students answer wrong.

Can't tell if she seriously thinks her teaching is good or if she enjoys making even the easiest parts of the course as hard as possible. Not sure how she still has a job since people have apparently been complaining for at least the past seven years.
Worst prof I have ever had. Avoid at all costs

Corina seems like a nice person and very interested in her field of work, but I don't think teaching's her forte. She just reads off slides and mumbles a lot. Lots of learning on your own, especially for a 2 credit course, and did not accommodate at all during the strike. Her lectures were hard to understand. I would avoid her if possible.

Corina's really nice and sweet. She listens to students and reweighed our grading scheme due to requests. She also gave us the option for an extra hour to do the final. Some of these negative reviews are overexaggerated and she's not a bad prof as long as you go to lectures. She does lots of example questions in class which helped a lot for exams.

By far one of the worst prof I've had in my academic career. She was very unreliable and not punctual when it came to meetings she herself would organized. Very condescending and unfriendly. Forced to learn content on our own. Please avoid.
ABSOLUTELY DO NOT TAKE A CLASS W HER. clearly does not want to teach and has no passion in her teaching

I found her instructional approach to be severely lacking and the quality of the teaching left much to be desired The material was poorly explained Her slides had overlapping writing. She was over 45 mins late to her own office hours. When asked to re-explain concepts, she berated students. Her job is to teach, not to make the class a living hell.
It was significantly hard to understand her lectures. Very unorganized and no help/support. She won't answer any emails and very passive aggressive.

The final was almost a MONTH ago at this point and she STILL hasn't posted any grades or anything even though literally the whole thing was scantron. I've literally had written finals graded in like 2 days idk how it takes a freaking month to scan some pieces of paper. Generally just a bad prof avoid her if you can.

I had a decent grade in CHEM 121 and I heard 122 would be easier, I was sorely mistaken. The lectures were impossible to understand and were copied and pasted directly from the textbook. No practice questions for exams and the content for the LON CAPPA questions were not usually covered in class. I probably have to take this course again. Avoid.

Honestly, the worst professor I've had in my whole life she doesn't teach and she marks so hard. She gives no practice questions no and her lectures make it harder to understand. Lowkey forgot what I knew after going to her lectures. I hope she reads these and reconsiders the grades that shes gonna give us. Praying for that curve at this point.
if I could give her a 0/5 I would

If you don't grasp chem concepts already, do not take this professor! Her slides are completely copied from the textbook and doesn't even break it down on how we get to the answer. The MT average was in 45%. If you care about your Gpa and sanity, avoid at all costs!
absolutely the worst prof at sfu. id rather take a whole semester off than take a course with Corina honestly its a waste of time.

worst prof ever at SFU cant even fathom that she's still a prof, lectures are full of stuff that makes the concept so much harder, reads off the slide monotone and with her heavy accent makes it 10x harder t understand doesn't go into detail and expects us to know what she's talking about, doesn't offer feedback makes homework due day before exam.
I teached myself everything, I did not learn anything from her. she is not a bad person but did not motivate us at all.

Just took the final for this class, and I managed to score quite above the class average for the midterm, no thanks to Professor Andreoiu. I taught myself everything. I understand if you do not have a natural ability to teach, but it is sad how incredibly lazy she is. Complains about how she is tired in the middle of the lecture.
Good person, but not good at teaching. Everyone says 122 is easier than 121 but this was harder than expected. Tests are pretty fair though. Organic chem tutor and the textbook saved my life.

If you get a lot of wrongs in an exam and you want to go over the answers during her office hours, she will legit throw you the answer key without bothering to spend time going over the solutions step by step. Plus she doesn't upload an answer key to the exam at all. Just don't take anything with this prof.
Easy class made insanely hard

avoid at all costs!! never replies to emails. cancels office hours. expects students to understand everything and not ask any questions. Doesn't answer lon-capa questions even in the middle of a strike. exams are just bad. PLEASE AVOID.
To be honest,her lectures are empty and nobody went after the first two lectures. She is really difficult to understand. She may be a good chemist but she is not for sure a good prof.

Genuinely the worst professor I have ever had and it is shocking she still has a job. Posted the wrong syllabus for starters which is insane in itself. Also decided that she should teach a class with material included on the final ON THE DAY OF THE FINAL. Assigned homework due after final, zero help, and assigned textbook as practice.

I got a B+ in chem 121 and this class is supposed to be easier....not with Corina tho! gave us no practice final NOTHING except q's in textbook (half don't have an answer). I will literally need to take this course again lol cus of her incapability to teach. DO NOT TAKE ANNNNNYYYYYYYYYYYYY COURSE WITH THIS WOMAN SAVE URSELF.
be prepared to teach yourself as going to lectures is pointless. Worst prof I have had at SFU by far!

I saw her rating but thought I'd do okay as I did well in chem 121. It is beyond me how someone could possibly be this terrible at their job and show such disregard for students. She really goes the extra mile to make sure there is no help available to us whatsoever, including no info about exams. A seagull would provide more engaging lectures.

RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN RUN

I'm acc confused how she has a job at sfu when she has been getting 1 star reviews over the last DECADE. If she's the only prof available just take the course at a Dif time. Our final is in 2 days but she's still teaching and gave us an assignment due the day before the final and 1 a week after the course ends. other reviews are not exaggerating.

It's a super condensed course which should be easier than 121 but with this professor think again. No real interaction with the students and offers little to no practice or resources for the exams. Avoid at all costs, unless you want to get a bad grade.

Literally the worst teacher i have ever had. This is the first time i have made a rating and am doing it specifically because of her. She literally does not care about her students whatsoever. She reads off her lecture slides the whole time in a monotone mumble, is unhelpful in email and office hours and gives no support to students. Avoid avoid!!!

If you get stuck with her don't even bother showing up to lec she drones on in the same montone voice the whole time and doesn't know what she's doing 99% of the time. Save your time and read the textbook/study it yourself she's completely useless and incapable of teaching even the easiest concepts. Literally sent me into a depressive spiral istg.

you have to teach the material to yourself. she just reads of the slides in a monotone voice. Went to her office hours and she basically belittles you and isn't helpful at all. didn't provide practice midterm or practice final. the loncapa is due the day before the exam, another is due after class is fully over. no one comes to class...no curve btw

Professor Andreoiu does not know how to TEACH! She vaguely introduces topics but never does any examples.Her exam includes questions we never covered, she doesn't set her students up for success.She is always in a rush after class but never available during office hour. Lastly it is impossible to understand lecture, shes always mumbling.

she is absolutely awful. the only chemistry she does is the dilution of the textbook and then puts it on 20 slides which she barely manages to communicate to the class. i don't think anybody understands what's going on in lecture because she just says stuff without explaining. i asked her a question and she ended up confusing me even more lol

our midterm which is worth 30% is in a few hours and NO ONE is prepared bc of her lack of teaching. she doesn't give practice exams, doesn't do practice problems in class, and her lectures are copy and pasted from the textbook. everyone in this class taught themselves everything.
she has made easy chemistry concepts EXTRA HARD. DO NOT TAKE class with this prof
She is the worst professor I have ever had. Careless, unable to teach, and provides no support or resources for students.
Worst Prof I have had at sfu by far. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Does not care about students whatsoever. Lectures are basically just screenshots of the textbook.......
if u have to take her just read the textbook honestly its way better than her unorganized/confusing notes. Makes no attempt to contact students after lecture JUST AVOID HER
Avoid avoid avoid, the worst! Very condescending and horrid lectures.
Very very very very very very very very very very bad. Not sure how she has this job still
She is the worst prof I have ever had. Do not take Chem122 with her. Her grading criteria was so unclear. She did not even release our final exam grades.
Avoid at all costs
Worst prof ever. Her lectures were useless. Basically self taught myself everything. The class itself is not hard, the prof makes it hard. Do not take with her unless you want your gpa to be ruined

She rushed the course for us and made us write our final a month before finals began. Her lectures were pre-recorded and were very difficult to understand. It was hard to get a hold of her. She made 8 quizzes worth 20% of our grade and each quiz was only out of 3. DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU HAVE THE OPTION

This professors lectures were near word-for-word from the textbook. For an asynchronous course, the lectures and note links were posted later than set time (sometimes even missed with no notice or email from prof) and were uploaded to different locations on Canvas almost EVERY time. Didnt reply to student emails. Study hard and use the textbook.

Prepare to be your own teacher. Corina is incapable of teaching. She's smart in chemistry, but she is terrible at teaching. The textbook, which you can find online for free, give clear explanations and examples. There are many times you cannot understand Corina, and she'll breeze through examples as if you already understand the content. Avoid her!

I found her class hard to follow. I could barely hear her and her notes were all over the place. I didn't even bother taking notes in class.. The only reason I survived that class was because of the textbook and tutorials. Also.. a 30% midterm out of 18 marks.. like what!?

I had a hard time understanding what was happening in class. She went way too fast during lecture and I could not keep up. I had to copy off of her slides and I learned more from the textbook. Tutorial was my best friend when taking this class.

Avoid at all costs. SFU has much better options for intro chem profs. Clearly doesn't want to be there, used other prof's slides so she never knew what was on them half the time, refused to do examples the first few weeks of class until another PROF had to ask. Waste of money when theres much better options. Just don't.

I dont recommend it, as I did not understand anything that was taught in class. It was hard to hear her and I could barely see the projector cause the settings were always so awful. Do yourself a favour and dont take this course, unless you want to teach yourself everything.

Corina is super super difficult to understand as she jumps from topic to topic and assumes we know a lot more than we do. Her midterm was 18 marks total.. all multiple choice and quite difficult. You learn nothing from lecture itself.. you must read the textbook and teach yourself the material through doing lon capa and the textbook questions.

She is such never interested in the course and just wants to finish up her useless lecture slides. She canceled her office hours every other week. She is pathetic in explaining topics and you should avoid her at all costs. She is not accessible and will ask you solve questions and go to TAs and only then come to her. By far, the worst professor.

This was by far the worst university prof I've had. She simply read off lecture slides and didn't engage in the material. I would avoid this prof at all costs as you should be prepared to teach yourself if you intend on taking her. It was hard to follow along and understand what she was saying. This is an easy course that she couldn't explain.

If you sit in the back of the lecture hall and talk all class you may find Corina's teaching style pretty hard and confusing to follow. Overall, I thought she was a great prof! She solved many questions in class, let you take pictures of her work, and was very approachable and easy-going! She really wants her students to learn and it shows!
awful awful awful

Taking any course with this prof is a waste of money! She reads right off the powerpoint slides, she doesn't even want students coming to her office hours and her exam structures are ridiculous. 18 multiple choice questions for a 30% midterm and 3 of the multiple-choice questions are written... I learn more from khan academy than this prof!

If I could give Corina a negative rating I would! I cannot describe with words just how awful she is! All she does is read of lecture slides word for word and skips important steps because she expects you to somehow know the material. Also, she replies late to emails, cancels office hours regularly, and is not approachable at all!

There is actually no point in showing up to lectures you basically have to teach yourself this class so i would avoid her as much as you can. It's also her first time teaching this class and she doesn't know what she's doing. She just takes pieces of stuff from the textbook.

By far the worst & the most negligent professor I have seen. She just assumes that people know everything and will carry on with her boring slides (which are apparently useless). Never ready to help outside class, late replies to emails and such a heavy exam. Highly recommend taking it with Prof. Mand. Avoid Corina at all costs or ruin your grades.

The only reason attendance is not mandatory for this class is because I was able to teach myself more on my own with the textbook in a day than I learned in lecture over two weeks. Has slides, but makes assumptions on students knowledge and makes big jumps, hard to follow her line of thought and keep track of whats happening at each step.

Explains concepts well in detail. I Had exams clashing with this class, but Khaled always figured something out. He stayed after class to help understand topics, super chill dude. Final is very similar to his practice exam. Midterm is similar to loncapas. Only tough part was the quizzes.
there was alot to remember with any chem class but his teaching was pretty accurate was told what to know and such with simple examples the final was a bit harder but other wise was chill

if you want to hold onto your dignity, don't take this class. the lack of examples is astounding. the lack of explanations is even worse. he will give you basic questions in class/tutorial, but then the tests are nothing like that. terrible class average. he only grades you on 4 things, the final is essentially half your grade. don't recommend lol.

his lectures were extremely boring, no matter how hard I tried I could not pay attention. he's not very engaging and does very few to no examples in class. the midterm was fair but the final was a little harder. quizzes were also rough and were difficult to do well on. he's friendly and wants you to do well, but not the best at teaching
he doesnt care at all. goes through stuff really fast, barely explains, and during lab he is gone for more than 90% of the time. had to self teach almost all the material

The style of his teaching made it difficult. He doesn't explain concepts in detail like other chem professors I had and his accent can make it a bit hard for me to understand. He goes very quickly in lectures so I have to teach myself. The exam happened very quickly as well.

Worst prof I've had at SFU so far! Her lectures are BORING, she just reads off the slides, your better off teaching yourself. If you ask her a question she looks at you like she doesn't know what's going on and ends up giving an answer that has nothing to do with what you asked. Midterm was really easy but final was brutal. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

She seems like a nice person but her lectures were terrible. They were not engaging, and even attending lectures did not help me learn She's so unclear. Doesn't even tell you how many questions to expect on midterms and finals Wish she was a little nicer.

If you get to know her, she's actually not that bad and if you ask her for help she is willing to help you as long as you show her that you're willing to work. Yes it is her first time teaching the class and her style of teaching may not agree with your way of learning but the material isn't extremely difficult anyways

The lectures were only 50 minutes long but felt like eternity. Worst prof I've ever had, brand new, just got out of school. Not respected by students. Lectures were completely useless and I've self taught everything. Had her for 122 and 126
He told me where to get cold water before exams. The water fountain he showed me really hits after chewing and inhaling some minty products.

CHEM122 with Dr. Canal was relatively straightforward. Very easy midterm but the final was relatively hard. It was difficult to hear him during lectures because of mic issues but he always posted lecture recordings. He goes over your midterm with you during office hours to see what questions you got wrong and explains questions thoroughly.

Dr. Canal is a very caring prof. He always offers extra help after lectures, even outside his office hours. Despite technical difficulties with his mic, he always posted the slides and recordings you could review in case you missed what he said in class. The midterm was quite straightforward, but the final was definitely harder.

1. Can't hear him in class cause he loves to stay quiet 
2. Worst final I have written yet, I dont know anyone that felt confident after that final, tested us on stuff he never taught 
3. Lectures were a waste of time as he read off the slides and just mumbled to himself

Voice is easy to zone out to. His lecture slides kinda sucked, so you def gotta pay attention in class. Idk why he made them in portrait instead of landscape. He posted lecture recording tho, which was nice. No huge complaints. Tutorials were optional. Idk how I got a B+, I guessed 60% of the final. Midterm was chill tho

Dr Canal is one of the good professors for Chem 122. 

His lectures are straightforward. However, sometimes, it can be hard to hear him (people in the backseat).

Lastly, his midterm is super easy, but his final is so brutal (I almost failed this exam). So, to get a B or more, you must put in tons of effort. 

HELLO! CAN YOU HEAR DR. CANAL!

John goes straight to the point with his lectures. He took the time to go over our midterm exams with us individually. The only thing I did not like about him was how easy it was to fall asleep in his lectures. The final was just brutal, make sure you do well on everything else.

I did amazing on the midterm but idk what he pulled on the final. Final was soo tough so make sure to do very well on midterm. John as a prof is good and helpful and nice but the class itself was a bit of work. his videos and everything are clear and quizzes were easy just the final was tough

Good guy, really helpful and responsive, especially considering how large this class is. First year science courses are going to be hard regardless of the prof but he was good and exams were fair. Nice clear lectures, and recordings posted online so we didn't have to attend lectures if we felt uncomfortable. I would take another class with him

He has ZERO respect to his students, mid was delayed for half an hour and 120 people were waiting in a crowded space during COVID, and then he scheduled a drop in office hour during his lab session to view the exam result, then he lets everyone wait outside indefinitely for an hour without any explanation, not one single person got to see him.
Laziest prof ever. Lectures are super straightforward and he just gets to the point without any bs.

I don't really like Chemistry but he's the best prof I've had at SFU so far. His lectures are straightforward and don't go on for hours. He tests you on what he teaches you on and he's always reachable by email. I wish he taught the lab portion as well.

Dr. Canal is an amazing prof! He always responds to emails and is very kind when you ask questions during office hours. His exams are completely fair. The only thing I did not like was the quizzes being worth 15% when each quiz was only out of 5 marks. But I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Good lectures with many examples, but he is very quiet. His midterm was super easy and then the final was dreadful. He seems really kind and caring in a super nerdy way and is good at explaining course concepts clearly.

Lectures are informative and straight forward. You will do good if you pay attention in class and ask questions. He always stays after class to answer questions from students. Found him to be more useful than the tas in the course. The midterm was relatively easy but the final was a bit difficult.

His lectures are nice if you want to fall asleep. The only thing I can hear in his lectures are "can you hear me now?" The rest are mumbles. His lectures are like a poorly recorded audiobook. If you can read the ppts yourself then I suggest you do. The Midterm was the easiest thing, the final on the other hand is substantially harder.
Easy midterm and hard final of concepts you dont go over in class

The mic volume is pretty low most of the times, so it can be hard to hear him. Otherwise, his lectures are okay and he relates it to real life or tells stories sometimes which is nice. His notes are fine too. Midterm (30%) was okay, but the final (50%) was harder. Lon capa 20% so do your homework lol

As others have said, he mumbles as if talking to himself fast under his breath. Very poor speaker through most of class. Only clear on "Can you hear me now?" Main lecture is a blur with bad ppt use and tons of errors. Nice guy and tries to help outside class, but you'd be better off reading the book! This class need not be hard, but it is.

He mumbles a lot in class, and even sitting near the front, I couldn't make up what he was even though I was sitting at the front. Final was really hard with tons of conceptual questions. He began the semester with great notes, then it started getting really messy. Exams were multiple choice and open ended questions were only on scantron sheets.
well organized and very helpful slides, midterm is easy...tutorial is waste of time and for final there will be alot of concepts than calculation.
Slept through alot of classes but still did okay because his notes were great. The midterm was okay, but the final was hard. Tutorials were useless, TA just went over loncapa.

very nice professor. he does mumble and tend to talk about things that are not directly related to the lecture material. however, they are useful and somewhat helpful. very nice to go to his office hours. very polite towards students and doesn't mind to spend extra minutes explaining lecture and loncapa materials after his assigned hours.

He's a nice guy, but I didn't think he was an effective teacher. Lectures went by too fast to understand some concepts and he basically pointed to a ppt slide, talked about it for a minute, and zoomed by to the next slide. Midterm was pretty fair but the final was tough so come prepared. Overall though, not a bad course.

Beware, he MUMBLES a lot, as if he's speaking to himself. Exams were fair, although quite a but more difficult than iclicker questions. Lectures are very boring, I only went for participation marks. Tutorials were useless, my TA only went thru lon-capa and that was it. Only go if you have specific questions

Strength: He did give good examples /elaborations in class which were not on lecture notes. If one was listening intently it was helpful in understanding the material (giving explanations in layman's terms).
 
 Weakness: I found that lectures went at such a fast pace that it was impossible to soak in anything he was saying and keep up. He did do ex

He seems to think he's got a sense of humour and spent a good chunk of every class trying to show it off. I stopped attending because the notes were online and he rambled off every ten minutes. Still a super easy course though, basically high school chem 12.
